subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: Idle threats from a coward
author: Lisby
full_text:
When do you get yours, Lance?

Mine is ETA 3rd week in January.

I swear to god, I feel like I'm adopting a child or something....

Ann


On Dec 3, 2007, at 2:29 PM, Lance Oliver wrote:

> Good stuff!
>
> I've likewise been engaged in pre-Box encouragement. For instance, I
> know I'm not the only one that has ideas come to them while taking a
> shower. Sunday afternoon, while so occupied, a notion came strongly
> over me, which is just the awaited nudge I was waiting for before
> buying a MiniBox myself. I had an almost electrical feeling to
> utilize a MiniBox at a shamanic studies class my shaman teacher
> begun, and I facilitate now.
>
> You see he past away back in April and it's my impression he wishes
> for that group to try communicating with him! I've got both eyes and
> ears open. I'm also going to ask the right sort of questions to test
> whether or not is indeed the fellow.
>
> I'm very hopefully but we shall see...
>
> Lance
>
> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Lisby <lisby@...> wrote:
> >
> > Congrats, Lance! :)
> >
> > I can't wait to start with mine.
> >
> > A few days ago I, as I was driving home alone, I turned on the
> tape
> > recorder I carry for interviews. I played it back as I was still
> > driving. During one part, I told them about the box and what I
> wanted
> > them to do once I had it. I said, "Talk to me, guys." Right
> afterward
> > a male voice said, "Talking." I was one big smile for an hour.
> >
> > Ann
> >
> >
> > On Dec 3, 2007, at 12:19 AM, Lance Oliver wrote:
> >
> > > Well, I've gone ahead and done it...
> > >
> > > I purchased one of Ron's MiniBox's!!
> > >
> > > No snowball will be safe in hell now!
> > >
> > > Tell you what, instead of asking Chris about life and death or
> heaven
> > > and hell, I plan to:
> > >
> > > 1)Take a training class provided freely by ASUP.
> > > 2)Engage in a little direct inquiry and testing of spirits.
> > > 3)Strongly encourage fearless people to find their own answers, by
> > > doing something likewise.
> > >
> > > Thanks,
> > > Lance
> > >
> > > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "babiarz3" <babiarz3@> wrote:
> > > >
> > > > Lance,
> > > > I think you make my point very well. You say you don't know
> Chris
> > > > personally but that it seems I am the one wearing rose colored
> > > > glasses. I do know Chris. Even when Frank is upset he
> says "Chris
> > > is a
> > > > nice guy". Chris' statements and beliefs have never changed
> while
> > > > others can be wishy washy depending on the day. The view that
> Chris
> > > > does not want any one to research the box besides him is BS. The
> > > fact
> > > > is that prior to Franks original yahoo group disappearing, Chris
> > > > provided a link directly to the schematics. In his
> presentations he
> > > > would tell people that the schematics were available online.
> Yet,
> > > > because he is against mass production, it MUST be because he
> wants
> > > the
> > > > research all to himself. Rose colored glasses or a case of only
> > > seeing
> > > > what is wanted? This is a fact compared to perceptions and
> > > opinions.
> > > >
> > > > Fact: Almost each and every user of a box or it's facsimile have
> > > > stated that lower energy/evil/dark... entities have spoken via
> the
> > > > device.
> > > >
> > > > Fact: Rick Moran states that the groups for testing will include
> > > > believers, skeptics, senior citizens, (now here's where it gets
> > > scary)
> > > > CHILDREN and HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS!
> > > >
> > > > - Couple the last two facts together and do the math. One
> mentally
> > > > unstable child or youth hears the box tell him it is right to
> kill
> > > or
> > > > rape or .....
> > > >
> > > > Fact: Rick Moran in his article about Tools being only as good
> as
> > > the
> > > > users states, "...know how they work before you go into the
> field."
> > > > So, in one place we are still testing, in another we are sending
> > > them
> > > > out in the field to be tested by groups that include children
> and
> > > high
> > > > school students. The good thing is that a nice little online
> > > tutorial
> > > > is available with some warnings. Phew! As long as this can't
> come
> > > back
> > > > on anyone I guess all the bases are covered (tongue in cheek).
> > > >
> > > > Fact: Chris has been the primary tester of the device in the
> field.
> > > > That fact deserves consideration, at the very least.
> > > >
> > > > Fact: Last night, a radio personality on Spooky South Coast
> claimed
> > > > that after he engaged the dark voices coming through the box,
> he was
> > > > physically attacked.
> > > >
> > > > Fact: Frank has stated that in the beginning Chris was the only
> one
> > > > who understood how the box should be used.
> > > >
> > > > Fact: Some people who have received boxes from Frank discovered
> they
> > > > were not able to use them although they worked fine for Frank.
> These
> > > > same people would not return the boxes to be looked at.
> > > >
> > > > Fact: After death communications have been received via both
> > > computers
> > > > and phones. If it were simply the devices and not the users
> would we
> > > > not have millions of these communications?
> > > >
> > > > Fact: Mark Macy states that in an after death communication
> > > > communication with Konstanin Raudive in which Mark asks " Can
> you
> > > tell
> > > > me about the equipment you use to produce a perfect, almost
> perfect
> > > > voice on earth?" Konstanin replies "Well it depends on your
> > > reception-
> > > > or mainly your psychic reception." This fact backs up the theory
> > > that
> > > > effective users are limited.
> > > >
> > > > Fact: In another after death communication Konstanin addresses
> > > contact
> > > > fields saying "...but if there is dissonance in the form of
> fears,
> > > > doubts, and animosities the contact field becomes
> cloudy...that's
> > > when
> > > > negative spirit groups close to earth in vibration can break
> into
> > > > existing bridges with troubling results."
> > > >
> > > >
> > > > And so yes, maybe I wear rose colored glasses. However, I am
> > > inclined
> > > > to believe that I have done my research and have availed myself
> of
> > > > quite a bit of information regarding this topic.
> > > >
> > > > With that said, I am holding an online event where people can
> ask
> > > > Chris the questions they want as long as they are formed in an
> > > > intelligent manner. If you are interested in attending the
> event you
> > > > can find the information on the front page of my site at
> > > > www.thepsinetwork.com I felt it unnecessary to attempt
> to "bridge
> > > the
> > > > gap" as well between speculation, insinuation and fact.
> > > >
> > > > Sincerely,
> > > > Babs
> > > >
> > > >
> > > > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "Lance Oliver" <orbhunterx@>
> wrote:
> > > > >
> > > > > Hey Bab,
> > > > >
> > > > > Even though I've newly begun to chime in here, it seems to me
> > > that
> > > > > some people are guilty of wearing rose colored glasses, as
> far as
> > > > > Chris is concerned. LOL! I don't know him personally, so I
> really
> > > > > don't know what really motivates him. Right or wrong, by
> > > conducting
> > > > > himself in the manner he has, it's understandable why his
> > > approach
> > > > > has drawn the scrutiny from his peers.
> > > > >
> > > > > Frankly, this entire effort is a great learning experience and
> > > > > potential healing for mankind! I encourage all of us
> researcher
> > > types
> > > > > to simply sit back, and take a deep breath or three. Consider
> > > > > together why we're doing this. Let's work on making this
> world a
> > > > > better place while we have breath...
> > > > >
> > > > > Success!
> > > > > Lance
> > > > >
> > > > > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "babiarz3" <babiarz3@> wrote:
> > > > > >
> > > > > > Bruce- Wow! That is a very bold statement, minus the name
> of the
> > > > > > person you are accusing (although it's clear who you are
> > > referring
> > > > > to).
> > > > > > I did read your apology for the negativity you've helped
> spread
> > > > > about
> > > > > > Christopher Moon. I acknowledge that your apology took a
> great
> > > deal
> > > > > of
> > > > > > humility. However, knee jerk reactions are exactly what I've
> > > been
> > > > > > talking about. People doing or saying without thought and
> > > > > consideration.
> > > > > >
> > > > > > --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "bhali333"
> > > > > > <paranormalinvestigating@> wrote:
> > > > > > >
> > > > > > > I think someone that stands to loose there bread and
> butter
> > > is
> > > > > making
> > > > > > > idle threats or having someone else do it. I would like to
> > > state
> > > > > for
> > > > > > > the record. SEND ME SOME DEATH THREATS YOU COWARD OR
> BETTER
> > > YET
> > > > > LETS
> > > > > > > SET UP A MEETING AND WE WILL SEE WHO IS LEFT FACE DOWN.
> > > > > > >
> > > > > > > Who ever you are you better hope I never find out, it's a
> > > bitch
> > > > > when
> > > > > > > the hunter becomes the hunted!
> > > > > > >
> > > > > > > If you got the balls contact me!
> > > > > > >
> > > > > > > Sum don't worry anyone that talks about doing something
> does
> > > only
> > > > > that
> > > > > > > TALK!
> > > > > > >
> > > > > > > Bruce
> > > > > > >
> > > > > >
> > > > >
> > > >
> > >
> > >
> > >
> >
>
>
>
